text:
The attached patch modifies the javah task to make it fall back to executing the
javah command if it cannot be run inprocess, for example if
com.sun.tools.javah.Main cannot be found.  This is required for gcj users, and
may be useful to users of other non-Sun JDKs too.
creator: gbenson@redhat.com

text:
If this patch is made against Ant 1.6.2 source it will be sorely out-of-date 
from Ant CVS HEAD.  There has been much refactoring from 1.6.2 to 1.6.3-4.
creator: mbenson@apache.org
gbenson@redhat.com
text:
I should be updating to 1.6.5 within the next couple of weeks.  I can post an
updated patch then...
I believe all patches should be against HEAD.
creator: alexeys@inventigo.com
carnold@apache.org
text: *** Bug 36587 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
This patch has been neglected for long enough that it has become irrelevant. I'm sorry about this.

Ant 1.8.2 has added support for gcjh which has superseeded this ticket. Ant 1.9.8 adds support for a forked javah with git commit 7ebbdc9.
